instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   Smoked CDCD3215C ic's
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> had a small hole in it.    I replaced both the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>'s 
I checked for CPU shorts and did not find any.
3.42v is present at the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>'s

PP3V42 is present
current draw is real low.  0.02A

I am a little green with these boards.    
Am I probably looking at a smoked CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   Smoked CDCD3215C ic's
threads.message: Do you have 20v on charger? Voltage on PPBUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   Smoked CDCD3215C ic's
threads.message: NO.   The <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>'s are not firing it up

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   Smoked CDCD3215C ic's
threads.message: 20v is not only related to <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> controllers. Check their LDO's, also check voltages around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   Smoked CDCD3215C ic's
threads.message:
Do you get any voltage at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

Inspect USB redriver chip from opposite side; many times dies too, if a <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip is blown.
